column4: Is anyone able to help me get my Linksys WPC300N PCMCIA card to work on a new install?
I am seeking help to get a Linksys PCMCIA wirless card to work. Any takers?
what model I have one of those already going
Is the WPC300N
ah that's a new one don't know about it
I got my card going by installing rt2500 in synaptic
but I don't think I was using the same device as you
have you experience with util to make it work with windows drivers?
you mean ndiswrapper yeah I've setup a few machines to use that
but you should first check if you can get native drivers because the windows one doesn't support you changing many configurations without having to reload stuff its rather lame
when I ndiswrapper -l it tells me that it finds the device.
did you download latest ndiswrapper from their website and do make uninstall before compiling it?
after that just follow what is listed in the wiki at the ndiswrapper site where it lists all the cards supported
your system might already be using a driver though if you do lshw as root and it doesn't list that device as unclaimed
I used Synaptic to download and install ndiswrapper.
yeah grab the latest
what is that feature where someone tells you to type something then hold alt and enter numbers to do funky symbols or other stuff? how do I enable that?
aszwetl: try checking with whatever window manager you use?
I am reading the ndiswrapper wiki right now.

kk there something called the ralink 2x00 drivers also abbreviated rt2x00 most popular one rt2500 and I think one of those most likely would work with your pcmia unless they've drastically changed their product line which I doubt
http://rt2x00.serialmonkey.com/wiki/index.php?title=Main_Page
